Low sunk in the vale by a copse,</br>Which fringes each side of the hill,</br>Behind a few acres of hops,</br>Prefac'd by a stream to the mill;</br>Erected in generous days</br>Ere pride to the cottage had crept,</br>Dissipation extended her blaze,</br>And Sylvan simplicity wept.

A structure tho' rural yet neat,</br>Stands capp'd with moss on its thatch,</br>Contentment, thy best belov'd seat,</br>Where honesty lifts up the latch:</br>Thy messuage, Palaemon, I sing,</br>What tho' the meridian ray</br>Effusions of light cannot bring,</br>Emit, in full current, the day!

The sash to the casement shall yield,</br>Avails it its pannel's so small?</br>No flattery here is conceal'd,</br>No colonades lead to the hall.</br>The yard spreads a carpet of straw,</br>Ye courtiers, too rich for your tread,</br>For nature despises your law,</br>Sits judge on the throne of the shed.

The dove-cotes, whose tenants of air</br>Coo tender endearments of love;</br>More grand than your temples of care,</br>Your Chinese pagodas above:</br>What tho' to this peaceful recess</br>No avenues fashion'd by art</br>The stranger's attention caress,</br>The wiles of appearance impart.

Yet here shall the oak not disdain</br>Her guardian protection to lend,</br>The walnut's Nestorian reign</br>Her arms of antiquity bend;</br>The elm, of circumference vast,</br>Admits to the swine a recess,</br>The sty thus secur'd from the blast,</br>Is cleans'd by the streamlet's ingress.

No porter to spurn from his gate</br>Palaemon's finances afford,</br>Does need make her moan at his grate,</br>The wretched to comfort's restor'd.</br>Monopoly stretches her hand,</br>Where wealth and where avarice reign,</br>He cheapens the grain of the land</br>To peasants who rear it with pain.

Tho' touch'd not by harmony's strains,</br>Obscure in the notice of Fame,</br>The Muses, averse to our plains,</br>Have never recorded my name:</br>Yet smit with what nature affords,</br>With fancy I venture my lay,</br>Description empowers my words,</br>Collecting a sprig from the bay.

Behold on the hook o'er the sill</br>The starling in ozier-bound chains,</br>Or strives rude accents to spell,</br>Or whistle the unnatural strains.</br>Beneath, at the mimic to bay,</br>The puppy affects a loud cry,</br>Yelps ceaseless his minutes away,</br>And watches the cage with his eye.

Coop'd up in the lodge see the hen</br>Strut prison'd — maternal her strife!</br>Poor Partlet!  the bars of thy pen</br>Confine a fond mother and wife;</br>Whose chickens tho' eager to roam,</br>Yet duteous revert to her call,</br>The vagrants turn suddenly home,</br>In clusters brood under the stall.

The goose, supercilious in stride,</br>Gabbles loud the mixt poultry among;</br>The duck, in Garrulity's pride,</br>To swim calls her down-coated young:</br>The magpie, tho' fam'd for a scold,</br>Assistance affords to my rhime,</br>Aspiring the architect bold</br>Rebuilds in the grey branch of time.

But mark the meridian meal,</br>The pudding of fruit shall I share;</br>Of bacon and delicate veal,</br>With greens — most salubrious fare!</br>The farmer with liberal mien,</br>Invited with welcome to taste</br>The wholesome repast sweet and clean,</br>Thy smiles hospitality grac'd.

Blush luxury, blush, for behold</br>Palaemon's the picture of health,</br>With coffers unburnish'd by gold,</br>And wishes unbounded by wealth:</br>'Tis exercise, rose of the plain,</br>And industry's temperate toil,</br>Adds sauce to the dish of the swain,</br>And kindles frugality' smile.

Past dinner, and now by the hearth</br>Thy produce, O Ceres, to bring,</br>The jug circles round, and with mirth</br>Thy roof shall rusticity ring;</br>The tube is alight in a trice,</br>Palaemon enhances his crops,</br>Anticipates chearful the price,</br>And prophecies wealth from his hops.

Nine winters have shiver'd with cold,</br>Since Anna was born to my friend,</br>She comes just return'd from the fold,</br>In her suite two small lambkins attend;</br>The nurslings, soft emblems so sweet,</br>She couples in one silken band,</br>Companions of innocence meet,</br>Dependent for food on her hand.

What pencil so fine to pourtray</br>A scene so amazingly fair?</br>In Anna the blushes of May</br>A stranger's appearance declare:</br>With rapture Palaemon reviews</br>This pledge of connubial bliss,</br>Whose presence his sorrow renews,</br>Increas'd by an innocent kiss!

Ah, friend!  how expressive that tear,</br>So prone on reflexion to start!</br>It speaks as it gushes — I hear</br>The anguish'd detail of thy heart!</br>I know thy Eustatia was fair,</br>Was virtuous!  and thou wast so kind,</br>That Hymen so happy a pair</br>In solitude seldom could find.

O Solitude!  oft in thy shade,</br>Remote from misfortune and noise,</br>This pair, sweet content, with thy aid,</br>Have shar'd undegenerate joys:</br>Did spring mantle over the mead,</br>He brush'd off the dew the morn,</br>Transported to view in the seed</br>The promise of young-bladed corn.

Did summer his closures embrown,</br>How jocund and blith was his heart,</br>Did Autumn his industry crown,</br>Reward to his labour impart.</br>Each season had charms to delight,</br>Eustatia was life to his breast,</br>She sweeten'd his morning and night,</br>And lull'd all his cares into rest.</br>
